repository.corpname: Washington State University Libraries, Manuscripts, Archives and Special Collections

did.unittitle: Bureau of Visual Teaching, Washington State University, Women's Health Ephemera Collection
did.abstract: Women's health education ephemera, including teaching manuals, educational pamphlets for girls, and a poster collected in a reference file to accompany the instructional film "The Story of Menstruation."

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of women's health education ephemera, including teaching manuals, educational pamphlets for girls, and a poster collected in a reference file to accompany the instructional film "The Story of Menstruation" (Walt Disney Productions, 1946). This file was created and maintained by the Washington State University Bureau of Visual Teaching, to be circulated to educators using the film.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

prefercite.p: [Item Description] Bureau of Visual Teaching, Washington State University, Women's Health Ephemera Collection
Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries, Pullman, WA.

acqinfo.p: This collection was transferred to Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections from the WSU Libraries' Media Materials and Reserves department in 2016 (MS.2016.32).

processinfo.p: Cheryl Gunselman processed this collection in 2016.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
